author: Sam Schechner
title: Stage Is Set for Battle Over Data Privacy in Europe
text:
A pizza shop needs your address to deliver your pizza. A chat app service needs your selfie if you want to send it to friends. But do internet giants like Facebook and Google really need a list of websites you recently visited?
A battle is looming in Europe over what information Facebook Inc., Alphabet Inc.’s Google and other companies can... RELATED VIDEO Facebook: No 'Wild Changes' in User Behavior Amid Data Furor Carolyn Everson, Facebook’s vice president of global marketing solutions, says that Facebook hasn't seen a huge change in consumer behavior amid widespread concerns over its handling of data and consumer privacy.
